column.name: aid
column.description: The ID of the album being queried. The aid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the aid is a string, you should always wrap the aid in quotes when referenced in a query. The aid is unique only for a given user.

column.name: owner
column.description: The user ID of the owner of the album being queried.

column.name: cover_pid
column.description: The ID of the photo used as the cover for the album being queried. The cover_pid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the cover_pid is a string, you should always wrap the cover_pid in quotes when referenced in a query.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the album being queried.

column.name: created
column.description: The date that the album being queried was created.

column.name: modified
column.description: The date that the album being queried was last updated.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the album being queried.

column.name: location
column.description: The location for the album being queried.

column.name: size
column.description: The number of photos in the album being queried.

column.name: link
column.description: The URL to the album being queried.

column.name: visible
column.description: Indicates who can see the album. The value can be one of friends, friends-of-friends, networks, everyone, or custom (if the visibility doesn't match any of the other values). This information is available only to the album owner.

column.name: modified_major
column.description: Indicates the time a major update (like addition of photos) was last made to the album.

column.name: edit_link
column.description: The URL for editing the album.

column.name: type
column.description: The type of photo album. Can be one of: profile: The album containing profile pictures mobile: The album containing mobile upload photos wall The album containing photos posted to a user's Wall normal: For all other albums.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The object_id of the album on Facebook. Use the object_id to let users comment on an album with the Comments API.

column.name: can_upload
column.description: Determines whether a given UID can upload to the album. It is true if the following conditions are met: * The user owns the album. * The album is not a special album like the profile pic album. * The album is not full.

column.name: app_id
column.description: The ID of the application being queried.

column.name: api_key
column.description: The API key of the application being queried.

column.name: canvas_name
column.description: The string appended to apps.facebook.com/ to navigate to the application's canvas page.

column.name: display_name
column.description: The name of the application.

column.name: icon_url
column.description: The URL identifying the application's icon image.

column.name: logo_url
column.description: The URL identifying the application's logo image.

column.name: company_name
column.description: The name of the company that built the application. Note: Only one of company_name and developers will contain data, never both.

column.name: developers
column.description: A list of records, where each record identifies a Facebook user who is marked as a developer of the application. Note: Only one of company_name and developers will contain data, never both.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the application, as provided by the developer.

column.name: daily_active_users
column.description: The number of Facebook users who've used the application in the last day.

column.name: weekly_active_users
column.description: The number of Facebook users who've used the application in the last seven days.

column.name: monthly_active_users
column.description: The number of Facebook users who've used the application in the last 30 days.

column.name: category
column.description: The category the application can be found under.

column.name: subcategory
column.description: The subcategory the application can be found under.

column.name: checkin_id
column.description: The ID of the check-in in the stream.

column.name: author_uid
column.description: The ID of the user making the checkin.

column.name: page_id
column.description: The ID of the Page representing the location.

column.name: app_id
column.description: The ID of the application that made the checkin.

column.name: post_id
column.description: The ID of the post in the stream.

column.name: coords
column.description: An array containing the latitude, longitude, and accuracy of the location.

column.name: timestamp
column.description: A Unix timestamp of the checkin.

column.name: tagged_uids
column.description: An array of user IDs of users tagged in the checkin.

column.name: message
column.description: The message the author posted with the checkin.

column.name: xid
column.description: The external ID of the fb:comments being queried. You can specify more than one XID.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The object_id of an object on Facebook. This can be a video, note, link, photo, or photo album. Note that for photos and albums, the object_id must be queried from the photo and album FQL tables. Note that in the photo and album tables, object_id is a different field from pid and aid. You must specify either an xid or an object_id.

column.name: post_id
column.description: The ID of the post in the stream.

column.name: fromid
column.description: The user submitting a comment.

column.name: time
column.description: A Unix timestamp associated with the creation time of a comment.

column.name: text
column.description: The text of a comment.

column.name: id
column.description: A unique ID for a given XID for each comment.

column.name: username
column.description: The user name that a user entered when they posted a comment. In these cases, the fromid returned will be 0. Note that user names for valid users are not returned here.

column.name: reply_xid
column.description: The target XID for Feed stories generated by the user; applications can retrieve comments made to that story by calling this XID.

column.name: app_id
column.description: The application ID. You can specify more than one application ID.

column.name: xid
column.description: The [XID|external ID] of the fb:comments object being queried.

column.name: count
column.description: The number of comments associated with an XID.

column.name: updated_time
column.description: A Unix timestamp indicating the most recent time a comment was made.

column.name: source_id
column.description: The ID of the user, the source of the connection.

column.name: target_id
column.description: The target(s) of the connection. The ID of the friend or Facebook Page with whom the specified user is either a friend or fan/supporter.

column.name: target_type
column.description: Indicates whether the target is a user or a page.

column.name: is_following
column.description: Indicates whether the source is connected to the target Page (for example, if the source is a supporter or fan).

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The most recent time the connection was updated.

column.name: is_deleted
column.description: Indicates whether the source severed the connection.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID associated with the cookie.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the cookie.

column.name: value
column.description: The value of the cookie.

column.name: expires
column.description: Time stamp when the cookie should expire. If not specified, the cookie never expires.

column.name: path
column.description: Path relative to the application's callback URL, with which the cookie should be associated. Default value is /

column.name: developer_id
column.description: The user ID of the application developer being queried.

column.name: application_id
column.description: The application ID of any applications associated with the developer.

column.name: domain_id
column.description: The domain id.

column.name: domain_name
column.description: The domain name.

column.name: owner_id
column.description: The ID of the profile who owns the domain. This can be a page, application, or user ID.

column.name: domain_id
column.description: The ID of the domain being queried.

column.name: eid
column.description: The ID of the event being queried.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the event being queried.

column.name: tagline
column.description: The tagline or summary of the event being queried.

column.name: nid
column.description: The network ID of the event being queried.

column.name: pic_small
column.description: The URL to the small-sized profile picture for the event being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_big
column.description: The URL to the largest-sized profile picture for the event being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 200px and a maximum height of 600px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic
column.description: The URL to the medium-sized profile picture for the event being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 100px and a maximum height of 300px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: host
column.description: The name of the host of the event being queried.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the event being queried.

column.name: event_type
column.description: The category of the event being queried. For a listing, see Event Categories.

column.name: event_subtype
column.description: The event type for the event being queried. For a listing, see Event Categories.

column.name: start_time
column.description: The starting date and time of the event being queried.

column.name: end_time
column.description: The ending date and time of the event being queried.

column.name: creator
column.description: The user ID of the creator of the event being queried.

column.name: update_time
column.description: The time that the event being queried was last updated.

column.name: location
column.description: The location of the event being queried.

column.name: venue
column.description: The venue where the event being queried is being held.

column.name: privacy
column.description: The privacy setting of the event being queried, indicating whether the event is OPEN, CLOSED, or SECRET.

column.name: hide_guest_list
column.description: Indicates whether to hide the guest list on the event's page, where true means to hide the guest list.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the user for the event being queried.

column.name: eid
column.description: The ID of the event being queried.

column.name: rsvp_status
column.description: The reply status of the user for the event being queried. There are four possible return values: attending, unsure, declined, and not_replied.

column.name: profile_id
column.description: The ID of the user being queried.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the relative, which is returned if the relationship is confirmed and links to another profile.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the relative, which is returned if the relationship is not linked to another profile.

column.name: birthday
column.description: The birthday of the relative, which is returned if the relationship is not linked to another profile.

column.name: relationship
column.description: A string describing how the relative is related to the user being queried.

column.name: uid1
column.description: The user ID of the first user in the pair being queried.

column.name: uid2
column.description: The user ID of the second user in the pair being queried.

column.name: uid_from
column.description: The user ID of the user making the friend request.

column.name: uid_to
column.description: The user ID of the user receiving the friend request (which must be the logged-in user if uid_from is not the logged-in user).

column.name: owner
column.description: The user ID of the user who created the friend list.

column.name: flid
column.description: The ID of the friend list.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the friend list.

column.name: flid
column.description: The ID of the friend list.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the friend list member.

column.name: gid
column.description: The group ID of the group being queried.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the group being queried.

column.name: nid
column.description: The network ID for the network to which the group being queried belongs, if any.

column.name: pic_small
column.description: The URL to the smallest-sized photo for the group being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_big
column.description: The largest-sized photo for the group being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 200px and a maximum height of 600px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic
column.description: The medium-sized photo for the group being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 100px and a maximum height of 300px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the group being queried.

column.name: group_type
column.description: The category of the group being queried.

column.name: group_subtype
column.description: The group type for the group being queried.

column.name: recent_news
column.description: The contents of the Recent News field of the group being queried.

column.name: creator
column.description: The user ID of the user who created the group being queried.

column.name: update_time
column.description: The last time the group being queried was updated.

column.name: office
column.description: The location of the office of the group being queried.

column.name: website
column.description: The URL for the Web site of the group being queried.

column.name: venue
column.description: The venue of the group being queried. This is an object containing street, city, state, country, zip, latitude, and longitude fields.

column.name: privacy
column.description: The privacy setting of the group being queried, indicating whether the group is OPEN, CLOSED, or SECRET.

column.name: version
column.description: The group version. New groups are versioned > 0.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the member of the group being queried.

column.name: gid
column.description: The ID of the group being queried.

column.name: positions
column.description: Any positions taken by the member of the group being queried.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The object for which you are retrieving metrics.

column.name: metric
column.description: The usage data to retrieve.

column.name: end_time
column.description: The end of the period during which the metrics were collected, expressed as a unix time.

column.name: period
column.description: The length of the period during which the metrics were collected, in seconds.

column.name: value
column.description: The value of the requested metric.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The object_id of an object on Facebook. This can be a video, note, link, photo, or photo album. Note that for photos and albums, the object_id must be queried from the photo and album FQL tables. Note that the object_id is a different field from the photo table's pid field and the album table's aid field.

column.name: post_id
column.description: The id of a post on Facebook. This can be a stream post containing a status, video, note, link, photo, or photo album. These post IDs must be queried from the stream FQL table.

column.name: user_id
column.description: The user who likes this object.

column.name: link_id
column.description: The unique identifier for the link.

column.name: owner
column.description: The user ID for the user who posted the link.

column.name: owner_comment
column.description: The comment the owner made about the link.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The time the user posted the link.

column.name: title
column.description: The title of the link, as taken from the site's title meta tag.

column.name: summary
column.description: A summary of the link, as taken from the site's description meta tag.

column.name: url
column.description: The actual URL for the link.

column.name: image_urls
column.description: The URLs to the images associated with the link, as taken from the site's link tag.

column.name: url
column.description: The URL to the Web page users can share with Facebook Share. This is the indexable field in the table, so you must specify it in your query's WHERE clause. To specify more than one URL, you must use the IN operator in the query's WHERE clause.

column.name: normalized_url
column.description: The normalized URL for the page being shared.

column.name: share_count
column.description: The number of times users have shared the page on Facebook.

column.name: like_count
column.description: The number of times Facebook users have "Liked" the page.

column.name: comment_count
column.description: The number of comments users have made on the shared story.

column.name: total_count
column.description: The total number of times the URL has been shared, liked, or commented on.

column.name: folder_id
column.description: The ID of the folder being queried. The ID can be one of: 0 (for Inbox), 1 (for Outbox), or 4 (for Updates).

column.name: viewer_id
column.description: The ID of the user whose Inbox you are querying.

column.name: name
column.description: A short description of the folder being queried.

column.name: unread_count
column.description: The number of unread threads in the folder being queried.

column.name: message_id
column.description: A unique ID for the message being queried.

column.name: thread_id
column.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.

column.name: author_id
column.description: The ID of the user who wrote this message.

column.name: body
column.description: The content of the message.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The time the message was sent.

column.name: attachment
column.description: An array of information about the attachment to the message. This is the attachment that Facebook returns.

column.name: viewer_id
column.description: The ID of the user whose Inbox you are querying. Defaults to session user.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the current user.

column.name: note_id
column.description: The unique identifier for the note.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The time the user created the note.

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The most recent time the user edited the note.

column.name: content
column.description: The body of the note.

column.name: title
column.description: The title of the note.

column.name: notification_id
column.description: The ID of the notification. This ID is not globally unique, so the recipient_id must be specified in addition to it.

column.name: sender_id
column.description: The user ID of the sender of the notification.

column.name: recipient_id
column.description: The user ID of the recipient of the notification. It is always the current session user.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The time the notification was originally sent. Notifications older than 7 days are deleted and will not be returned via this table or notifications.getList.

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The time the notification was originally sent, or the time the associated application's notifications were hidden or unhidden by the user, whichever is later.

column.name: title_html
column.description: The main body of the notification in HTML.

column.name: title_text
column.description: The plaintext version of title_html, with all HTML tags stripped out.

column.name: body_html
column.description: Any additional content the notification includes, in HTML.

column.name: body_text
column.description: The plaintext version of body_html, with all HTML tags stripped out.

column.name: href
column.description: The URL associated with the notification. This is usually a location where the user can interact with the subject of the notification.

column.name: app_id
column.description: The ID of the application associated with the notification. This may be a third-party application or a Facebook application (for example, Wall).

column.name: is_unread
column.description: Indicates whether the notification has been marked as read. Use notifications.markRead to mark a notification as read.

column.name: is_hidden
column.description: Indicates whether the user hid the associated application's notifications.

column.name: url
column.description: The URL for the webpage being queried

column.name: id
column.description: The ID of the Graph object represented by the URL

column.name: type
column.description: The type of object the URL represents (note: 'Page' incorporates any URL with an 'og:type' specified)

column.name: site
column.description: The normalized domain name the URL is on

column.name: page_id
column.description: The ID of the Page being queried.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the Page being queried.

column.name: pic_small
column.description: The URL to the small-sized picture for the Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_big
column.description: The URL to the large-sized profile picture for the Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 200px and a maximum height of 600px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_square
column.description: The URL to the square profile picture for the Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width and height of 50px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic
column.description: The URL to the medium-sized profile picture for the Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 100px and a maximum height of 300px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_large
column.description: The URL to the largest-sized profile picture for the Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 396px and a maximum height of 1188px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: page_url
column.description: The profile URL for the Page being queried. If the Page admin specified a username for the Page, page_url contains the username.

column.name: type
column.description: The type of Page being queried.

column.name: website
column.description: The URL to the Web site of of the Page being queried.

column.name: has_added_app
column.description: Indicates whether a calling application has been added by the Page being queried.

column.name: founded
column.description: The date when the subject of the Page being queried was founded. This field may be blank.

column.name: company_overview
column.description: Summary of the subject of the Page being queried. This field may be blank.

column.name: mission
column.description: The mission statement of the organization that is the subject of the Page being queried. This field may be blank.

column.name: products
column.description: The products offered by the company on the Page being queried. This field may be blank.

column.name: location
column.description: The location of the Page being queried, including the street, city, state, country and zip (or post code). Some of the fields may be blank.

column.name: parking
column.description: The type of parking available at the location of the Page being queried.

column.name: public_transit
column.description: The type of public transportation available near the location of the Page being queried. This field may be blank.

column.name: hours
column.description: The hours of operation for the Page being queried.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID for the admin of the Page being queried.

column.name: page_id
column.description: The ID of the Page being queried.

column.name: type
column.description: The type of Page being queried.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID for the fan of the Page being queried.

column.name: page_id
column.description: The ID of the Page being queried.

column.name: type
column.description: The type of Page being queried.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The unix time when the user liked (aka 'fanned') this page

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the current user, or the page_id of the Page.

column.name: PERMISSION_NAME
column.description: Indicates whether the user granted your application the extended permission. You can see the list of permissions here.

column.name: permission_name
column.description: The name of the extended permission.

column.name: header
column.description: A descriptive header for the extended permission.

column.name: summary
column.description: A longer description of the permission.

column.name: pid
column.description: The ID of the photo being queried. The pid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the pid is a string, you should always wrap the pid in quotes when referenced in a query. The pid is unique only for a given user.

column.name: aid
column.description: The ID of the album containing the photo being queried. The aid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the aid is a string, you should always wrap the aid in quotes when referenced in a query. The aid is unique only for a given user.

column.name: owner
column.description: The user ID of the owner of the photo being queried.

column.name: src_small
column.description: The URL to the thumbnail version of the photo being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 75px and a maximum height of 225px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: src_small_height
column.description: Height of the thumbnail version, in px. This field may be blank.

column.name: src_small_width
column.description: Width of the thumbnail version, in px. This field may be blank.

column.name: src_big
column.description: The URL to the full-sized version of the photo being queried. The image can have a maximum width or height of 720px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: src_big_height
column.description: Height of the full-sized version, in px. This field may be blank.

column.name: src_big_width
column.description: Width of the full-sized version, in px. This field may be blank.

column.name: src
column.description: The URL to the album view version of the photo being queried. The image can have a maximum width or height of 130px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: src_height
column.description: Height of the album view version, in px. This field may be blank.

column.name: src_width
column.description: Width of the album view version, in px. This field may be blank.

column.name: link
column.description: The URL to the page containing the photo being queried.

column.name: caption
column.description: The caption for the photo being queried.

column.name: created
column.description: The date when the photo being queried was added.

column.name: modified
column.description: The date when the photo being queried was last modified.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The object_id of a photo on Facebook. Use the object_id to let users comment on a photo with the Comments API.

column.name: pid
column.description: The ID of the photo being queried. The pid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the pid is a string, you should always wrap the pid in quotes when referenced in a query.

column.name: subject
column.description: For tagged users, use the user ID of the subject for the tag being queried. For photos associated with events or groups, use the eid or gid for subject.

column.name: text
column.description: The content of the tag being queried.

column.name: xcoord
column.description: The center of the tag's horizontal position, measured as a floating-point percentage from 0 to 100, from the left edge of the photo.

column.name: ycoord
column.description: The center of the tag's vertical position, measured as a floating-point percentage from 0 to 100, from the top edge of the photo.

column.name: created
column.description: The date that the tag being queried was created.

column.name: page_id
column.description: The Facebook Page ID of the place

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the place.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the place.

column.name: geometry
column.description: An array describing where the location exists, in GeoJSON format. (This could be a point, a polygon, or other types of geometries.)

column.name: latitude
column.description: The latitude of the location.

column.name: longitude
column.description: The longitude of the location.

column.name: checkin_count
column.description: The number of times users have checked into the location.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The ID of an object on Facebook. This can be a video, note, link, photo, or photo album.

column.name: id
column.description: The object ID (this is an alias for the "object_id" column).

column.name: value
column.description: The privacy value for the object, one of EVERYONE, CUSTOM, ALL_FRIENDS, NETWORKS_FRIENDS, FRIENDS_OF_FRIENDS.

column.name: description
column.description: A description of the privacy settings. For CUSTOM settings, it can contain names of users, networks, and friend lists.

column.name: allow
column.description: The IDs of the specific users or friend lists that can see the object (as a comma-separated string).

column.name: deny
column.description: The IDs of the specific users or friend lists that cannot see the object (as a comma-separated string).

column.name: owner_id
column.description: The ID of the user who owns the object.

column.name: networks
column.description: The ID of the network that can see the object, or 1 for all of the user's networks.

column.name: friends
column.description: Which users can see the object. Can be one of EVERYONE, NETWORKS_FRIENDS, FRIENDS_OF_FRIENDS, ALL_FRIENDS, SOME_FRIENDS, SELF, or NO_FRIENDS.

column.name: id
column.description: A 64-bit int representing the user ID or Page ID.

column.name: name
column.description: The full name of the user or Page being queried.

column.name: url
column.description: The URL to a user's profile or Page. If the user or Page has a username, url contains the username.

column.name: pic
column.description: The URL to the small-sized profile picture for the user or Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_square
column.description: The URL to the square profile picture for the user or Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width and height of 50px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_small
column.description: The URL to the small-sized profile picture for the user or Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_big
column.description: The URL to the largest-sized profile picture for the user or Page being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 200px and a maximum height of 600px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: type
column.description: The type of profile, either user for a user profile or page for a Facebook Page.

column.name: username
column.description: The username of the user being queried.

column.name: uid1
column.description: The user ID of the first user in the pair being queried.

column.name: uid2
column.description: The user ID of the second user in the pair being queried.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the user being queried.

column.name: first_name
column.description: The first name of the user being queried.

column.name: last_name
column.description: The last name of the user being queried.

column.name: name
column.description: The full name of the user being queried.

column.name: locale
column.description: The two-letter country code for the user's locale. Codes used are the ISO 3166 alpha 2 code list.

column.name: affiliations
column.description: The corporate or educational networks to which the user being queried belongs. Regional networks have been deprecated and are no longer returned.

column.name: profile_url
column.description: The URL to a user's profile.

column.name: timezone
column.description: The time zone where the user being queried is located.

column.name: birthday
column.description: The birthday of the user being queried.

column.name: sex
column.description: The sex of the user being queried.

column.name: proxied_email
column.description: The proxied wrapper for a user's email address.

column.name: current_location
column.description: The city in which the user currently lives.

column.name: allowed_restrictions
column.description: A comma delimited list of Demographic Restrictions types a user is allowed to access. Currently, alcohol is the only type that can be returned.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the current user.

column.name: status_id
column.description: The ID of the status message.

column.name: time
column.description: The date and time the status message was posted.

column.name: source
column.description: The application that published the status originally.

column.name: message
column.description: The content of the status message.

column.name: post_id
column.description: The ID of the post from the user's stream. This field, when used as an index, is primarily used to re-retrieve posts. Otherwise, it is used to specify a post when using any of the stream setters.

column.name: viewer_id
column.description: The ID of the user whose stream you are querying. The viewer_id defaults to the active session key.

column.name: app_id
column.description: The application ID for the application through which the post was published. This includes application IDs for Facebook applications like Photos and Video.

column.name: source_id
column.description: The ID of the user, Page, group, or event whose posts you want to retrieve. This includes both posts that the user or Page has authored (that is, the actor_id is the source_id) and posts that have been directed at this target user, Page, group, or event (that is, the target_id is the source_id).

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The time the post was last updated, which occurs when a user comments on the post.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The time the post was published to the user's stream.

column.name: filter_key
column.description: The filter key to fetch data with. This key should be retrieved from stream.getFilters or querying the stream_filter FQL table.

column.name: attribution
column.description: For posts published by applications, this is the string that states through which application the post was published. For example, "Joe loves the Social Web (by MicroBloggerApp)."

column.name: actor_id
column.description: The user ID of the person who is the user taking the action in the post.

column.name: target_id
column.description: The user or Page to whom the post was directed.

column.name: message
column.description: The message written by the user.

column.name: app_data
column.description: An array of application-specific information supplied to Facebook to create the attachment to the post. This information is not needed to render a user's stream in your application, unless you need this information for special handing of your own application posts. This array includes: tbid (i64): A 64-bit int representing the template bundle ID, for posts that entered the stream through the now discontinued method feed.publishUserAction and similar calls that are not stream publishing methods (like stream.publish or Facebook.streamPublish). attachment_data (array): An array containing the template data, for posts that entered the stream through the now discontinued method feed.publishUserAction and similar calls that are not stream publishing methods (like stream.publish or Facebook.streamPublish). images (array): A JSON-encoded object containing any images associated with the story. These images are specified in Attachment (Streams) (and used to be specified in Template Data, if an application used a now discontinued method like feed.publishUserAction to create the post originally). action_links (array): An array containing the text and URL for each action link.

column.name: action_links
column.description: An array containing the text and URL for each action link.

column.name: attachment
column.description: An array of information about the attachment to the post. This is the attachment that Facebook returns.

column.name: comments
column.description: A sample array of comments added to a post. This list contains up to two comments to display along with stream content. To get the full list of comments, use stream.getComments or query the comment FQL table using the post_id of this post. The array contains the following fields: can_remove (bool): Indicates whether users can remove comments. can_post (bool): Indicates whether users can post comments. count (i32): The total number of comments added to the post. comment_list (array): A list of comment-type comments for this post. Comments are formatted as they would be when returned by the comment (FQL) table.

column.name: likes
column.description: An array of likes associated with the post. The array contains the following fields: href (string): The URL to a page showing the other users who've liked this post. count (i32): The total number of times users like the post. sample (array): A sample of users who like the post. friends (array): A list of the viewing user's friends who like the post. user_likes (bool): Indicates whether the viewing user likes the post. can_like (bool): Indicates whether the post can be liked.

column.name: privacy
column.description: The privacy setting for a post, indicating which of a user's friends or others can see the content.

column.name: type
column.description: Do not use this field as it's been deprecated. To determine what sort of post gets returned, look for the presence of an attachment (lack of an attachment indicates a status update), and if one is present, look at the attachment's media type (photo, Flash, mp3) to determine how you want to handle the post. Facebook for Adobe AIR uses this method, for example.

column.name: permalink
column.description: A link to the stream post.

column.name: xid
column.description: When querying for the feed of a live stream box, this is the xid associated with the Live Stream box (you can provide 'default' if one is not available).

column.name: uid
column.description: The ID of the user whose filters you are querying.

column.name: filter_key
column.description: A key identifying a particular filter for a user's stream. This filter is useful to retrieve relevant items from the stream table.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the filter as it appears on the home page.

column.name: rank
column.description: A 32-bit int that indicates where the filter appears in the sort.

column.name: icon_url
column.description: The URL to the filter icon. For applications, this is the same as your application icon.

column.name: is_visible
column.description: If true, indicates that the filter is visible on the home page. If false, the filter is hidden in the More link.

column.name: type
column.description: The type of filter. One of application, newsfeed, friendlist, network, or publicprofile.

column.name: value
column.description: A 64-bit ID for the filter type.

column.name: post_id
column.description: The ID of a post from the user's or Page's stream. This field, when used as an index, is used to retrieve users and the entities they've tagged.

column.name: actor_id
column.description: The user ID of the user or Page who tagged one or more entities in a post. This field, when used as an index, is used to retrieve all the posts and the entities the user has tagged.

column.name: target_id
column.description: The users, Pages, events, and other Facebook objects that have been tagged in one or more posts. This field, when used as an index, is used to retrieve all the entities that have been tagged in one or more posts.

column.name: thread_id
column.description: The ID of the thread being queried.

column.name: folder_id
column.description: The ID of the folder that belongs to the thread you are querying. The ID can be one of: 0 (for Inbox), 1 (for Outbox), or 4 (for Updates).

column.name: subject
column.description: The subject of the thread.

column.name: recipients
column.description: The user IDs of the recipients of the thread.

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The created_time of the most recent message in the thread.

column.name: parent_message_id
column.description: The ID of the message from which this thread was branched, or 0 if this thread is not a branch. The parent_message_id is a concatenation of the thread ID and the message ID, joined by an underscore.

column.name: parent_thread_id
column.description: The ID of the thread from which this thread was branched, or 0 if this thread is not a branch.

column.name: message_count
column.description: The number of messages in this thread.

column.name: snippet
column.description: A short bit of text from the most recent message.

column.name: snippet_author
column.description: The user ID of the author of the snippet.

column.name: object_id
column.description: The object that sent this message, or 0 if it was not sent by an object. You can get more information about this object in the profile table.

column.name: unread
column.description: This is 0 if the message is read, and it is higher than that if there are unread messages in the thread.

column.name: viewer_id
column.description: The ID of the user whose Inbox you are querying.

column.name: locale
column.description: The locale for the translations for which you are querying. See Facebook Locales for the list of currently supported locales. You must specify a single locale in your query.

column.name: native_hash
column.description: A hash of the native string and a description generated by the Translations application. It's a unique identifier for the string. The hash is generated by hashing the concatenation of the string followed by 3 colons, followed by the description, followed by a colon, using the tiger128,3 hashing algorithm. Query on this column to quickly return your application's native strings and their descriptions.

column.name: native_string
column.description: The actual text from your application you previously submitted for translation to the Translations application.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the native string needing translation. This text clarifies the context in which the text is used, and the meaning if it is ambiguous. This is shown to translators in the bulk translation user interface, among other places, and should describe the text well enough that someone can translate it without seeing it in the context of your application. In general a piece of text should always have a description unless it is a complete sentence whose meaning would be clear to a user who has never seen your application. If a description for the corresponding string or hash doesn't exist in the Translations database, this column returns null.

column.name: translation
column.description: The translation of the native string. If a translation for the corresponding string or hash doesn't exist in the Translations database, this column returns null.

column.name: approval_status
column.description: The approval status of the string. The status is one of: auto-approved: Automatically approved by our system, based on votes. approved: Manually approved by you, another developer of your application, or an authorized translator. unapproved: Not approved in any manner.

column.name: pre_hash_string
column.description: A concatenation of the native string and its description. This string is used to generate the native hash. The native string is concatenated with 3 colons, the description, then another colon. Query on this column if you want to check whether a random string and description exists. A query containing the pre_hash_string runs more slowly than a query containing the native_hash.

column.name: best_string
column.description: The translated string that gets displayed to a user translating your application. The user must be browsing Facebook in the locale of the approved translation. Querying on this column returns either a native string or translated string. If no entry for the corresponding native string exists in the Translations database, this column returns null.

column.name: message_id
column.description: Unique identifier of the message.

column.name: thread_id
column.description: Unique identifier of the thread.

column.name: subject
column.description: Subject of the message.

column.name: body
column.description: Body of the message.

column.name: unread
column.description: Flag indicating whether the message is unread.

column.name: timestamp
column.description: Last update time of the thread (Unix-type timestamp with millisecond resolution).

column.name: tags
column.description: Message tags.

column.name: sender
column.description: Sender of the message. This field is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: recipients
column.description: List of message recipients. Each element of the list is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: object_sender
column.description: Sender of the message in the case that it is a Facebook page, group or event. This field is an object with properties object_address_type (int) and id (string).

column.name: html_body
column.description: HTML representation of the message body.

column.name: attachments
column.description: List of attachment identifiers. Attachments correspond to any attached file.

column.name: attachment_map
column.description: Map from attachment identifiers to objects containing information about the attachment (file size, type, etc.). Each object has the following properties: id (string), type (int), mime_type (string), filename (string) and file_size (int).

column.name: shares
column.description: List of share identifiers. Shared items include links, videos, and photos as were supported in the old messaging system.

column.name: share_map
column.description: Map from share identifiers to objects containing information about the shared objects. Each object has the following properties: share_id (string), type (int), href (string), title (string), summary (string) and image (string).

column.name: thread_id
column.description: Unique identifier of the thread.

column.name: unread
column.description: Flag indicating whether the thread contains unread messages.

column.name: archived
column.description: Flag indicating whether the thread is archived.

column.name: num_messages
column.description: Total number of messages in the thread.

column.name: num_unread
column.description: Number of unread messages.

column.name: subject
column.description: Subject of the thread.

column.name: snippet
column.description: Fragment of the thread for use in thread lists.

column.name: timestamp
column.description: Last update time of the thread (Unix-type timestamp with millisecond resolution).

column.name: tags
column.description: Thread tags.

column.name: senders
column.description: List of participants who have sent a message in the thread. Each element of the list is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: participants
column.description: List of participants who are currently subscribed to the thread. Each element of the list is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: former_participants
column.description: List of former participants who have unsubscribed from the thread. Each element of the list is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: object_participants
column.description: List of participants who represent a Facebook page, group or event. Each element of the list is an object with properties object_address_type (int) and id (string).

column.name: single_recipient
column.description: For threads representing a two-person conversation this is the user ID of the other thread participant.

column.name: has_attachment
column.description: Flag indicating whether the thread contains a message which includes an attachment.

column.name: thread_id
column.description: Unique identifier of the thread.

column.name: type
column.description: Flag to indicate whether the action is a subscribe (1) or unsubscribe (2).

column.name: actor
column.description: The user who performed the action. This field is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: users
column.description: List of users on whom the action was performed. Each element of the list is an object with properties name (string), email (string) and user_id (string).

column.name: timestamp
column.description: Time at which the action was performed (Unix-type timestamp with millisecond resolution).

column.name: folder
column.description: Folder name (‘inbox’, ‘other’, ‘spam’ or ‘sent’).

column.name: unread_count
column.description: Number of unread threads in the folder.

column.name: unseen_count
column.description: Number of unseen threads in the folder.

column.name: last_seen_time
column.description: Last time the folder was accessed (Unix-type timestamp with millisecond resolution).

column.name: total_threads
column.description: Total number of non-archived threads.

column.name: uid
column.description: The user ID of the user being queried.

column.name: first_name
column.description: The first name of the user being queried.

column.name: middle_name
column.description: The middle name of the user being queried.

column.name: last_name
column.description: The last name of the user being queried.

column.name: name
column.description: The full name of the user being queried.

column.name: pic_small
column.description: The URL to the small-sized profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_big
column.description: The URL to the largest-sized profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 200px and a maximum height of 600px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_square
column.description: The URL to the square profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width and height of 50px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic
column.description: The URL to the medium-sized profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 100px and a maximum height of 300px. This URL may be blank.

column.name: affiliations
column.description: The networks to which the user being queried belongs. The status field within this field will only return results in English.

column.name: profile_update_time
column.description: The time the profile of the user being queried was most recently updated. If the user's profile has not been updated in the past three days, this value will be 0.

column.name: timezone
column.description: The time zone where the user being queried is located.

column.name: religion
column.description: The religion of the user being queried.

column.name: birthday
column.description: The birthday of the user being queried. The format of this date varies based on the user's locale.

column.name: birthday_date
column.description: The birthday of the user being queried, rendered as a machine-readable string. The format of this date never changes.

column.name: sex
column.description: The gender of the user being queried. This field will only return results in English.

column.name: hometown_location
column.description: The home town (and state) of the user being queried.

column.name: meeting_sex
column.description: A list of the genders the person the user being queried wants to meet.

column.name: meeting_for
column.description: A list of the reasons the user being queried wants to meet someone.

column.name: relationship_status
column.description: The type of relationship for the user being queried. This field will only return results in English.

column.name: significant_other_id
column.description: The user ID of the partner (for example, husband, wife, boyfriend, girlfriend) of the user being queried.

column.name: political
column.description: The political views of the user being queried.

column.name: current_location
column.description: The current location of the user being queried.

column.name: activities
column.description: The activities of the user being queried.

column.name: interests
column.description: The interests of the user being queried.

column.name: is_app_user
column.description: Indicates whether the user being queried has logged in to the current application.

column.name: music
column.description: The favorite music of the user being queried.

column.name: tv
column.description: The favorite television shows of the user being queried.

column.name: movies
column.description: The favorite movies of the user being queried.

column.name: books
column.description: The favorite books of the user being queried.

column.name: quotes
column.description: The favorite quotes of the user being queried.

column.name: about_me
column.description: More information about the user being queried.

column.name: hs_info
column.description: Information about high school of the user being queried.

column.name: education_history
column.description: Post-high school information for the user being queried.

column.name: work_history
column.description: The work history of the user being queried.

column.name: notes_count
column.description: The number of notes created by the user being queried.

column.name: wall_count
column.description: The number of Wall posts for the user being queried.

column.name: status
column.description: The current status of the user being queried.

column.name: has_added_app
column.description: Deprecated. This value is now equivalent to is_app_user.

column.name: online_presence
column.description: The user's Facebook Chat status. Returns a string, one of active, idle, offline, or error (when Facebook can't determine presence information on the server side). The query does not return the user's Facebook Chat status when that information is restricted for privacy reasons.

column.name: locale
column.description: The two-letter language code and the two-letter country code representing the user's locale. Country codes are taken from the ISO 3166 alpha 2 code list.

column.name: proxied_email
column.description: The proxied wrapper for a user's email address. If the user shared a proxied email address instead of his or her primary email address with you, this address also appears in the email field (see above). Facebook recommends you query the email field to get the email address shared with your application.

column.name: profile_url
column.description: The URL to a user's profile. If the user specified a username for his or her profile, profile_url contains the username.

column.name: email_hashes
column.description: An array containing a set of confirmed email hashes for the user. Emails are registered via the connect.registerUsers API call and are only confirmed when the user adds your application. The format of each email hash is the crc32 and md5 hashes of the email address combined with an underscore (_).

column.name: pic_small_with_logo
column.description: The URL to the small-sized profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 50px and a maximum height of 150px, and is overlaid with the Facebook favicon. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_big_with_logo
column.description: The URL to the largest-sized profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 200px and a maximum height of 600px, and is overlaid with the Facebook favicon. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_square_with_logo
column.description: The URL to the square profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width and height of 50px, and is overlaid with the Facebook favicon. This URL may be blank.

column.name: pic_with_logo
column.description: The URL to the medium-sized profile picture for the user being queried. The image can have a maximum width of 100px and a maximum height of 300px, and is overlaid with the Facebook favicon. This URL may be blank.

column.name: allowed_restrictions
column.description: A comma-delimited list of Demographic Restrictions types a user is allowed to access. Currently, alcohol is the only type that can get returned.

column.name: verified
column.description: Indicates whether or not Facebook has verified the user.

column.name: profile_blurb
column.description: This string contains the contents of the text box under a user's profile picture.

column.name: family
column.description: Note: For family information, you should query the family FQL table instead. This array contains a series of entries for the immediate relatives of the user being queried. Each entry is also an array containing the following fields: relationship -- A string describing the type of relationship. Can be one of parent, mother, father, sibling, sister, brother, child, son, daughter. uid (optional) -- The user ID of the relative, which gets displayed if the account is linked to (confirmed by) another account. If the relative did not confirm the relationship, the name appears instead. name (optional) -- The name of the relative, which could be text the user entered. If the relative confirmed the relationship, the uid appears instead. birthday -- If the relative is a child, this is the birthday the user entered. Note: At this time, you cannot query for a specific relationship (like SELECT family FROM user WHERE family.relationship = 'daughter' AND uid = '$x'); you'll have to query on the family field and filter the results yourself.

column.name: username
column.description: The username of the user being queried.

column.name: website
column.description: The website of the user being queried.

column.name: is_blocked
column.description: Returns true if the user is blocked to the viewer/logged in user.

column.name: contact_email
column.description: A string containing the user's primary Facebook email address. If the user shared his or her primary email address with you, this address also appears in the email field (see below). Facebook recommends you query the email field to get the email address shared with your application.

column.name: email
column.description: A string containing the user's primary Facebook email address or the user's proxied email address, whichever address the user granted your application. Facebook recommends you query this field to get the email address shared with your application.

column.name: third_party_id
column.description: A string containing an anonymous, but unique identifier for the user. You can use this identifier with third-parties.

column.name: vid
column.description: The ID of the video being queried. The vid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the vid is a string, you should always wrap the vid in quotes when referenced in a query. The vid is unique only for a given user. You can use the vid as an object ID in the Graph API.

column.name: owner
column.description: The user ID of the owner of the video being queried.

column.name: title
column.description: The name of the video being queried.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the video being queried.

column.name: thumbnail_link
column.description: The URL to the thumbnail image for the video being queried. This URL may be blank.

column.name: embed_html
column.description: The HTML code to embed the video.

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The date when the video being queried was last modified.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The date when the video being queried was added.

column.name: src
column.description: The source file for the standard quality version of the video.

column.name: src_hq
column.description: The source file for the high quality version of the video.

column.name: vid
column.description: The ID of the video being queried. The vid cannot be longer than 50 characters. Note: Because the vid is a string, you should always wrap the vid in quotes when referenced in a query.

column.name: subject
column.description: For tagged users, use the user ID of the subject for the tag being queried. For videos associated with events or groups, use the eid or gid for subject.

column.name: updated_time
column.description: The date when the video being queried was last modified.

column.name: created_time
column.description: The date when the video being queried was added.
